00005 InternalMessageProcessor::InternalMessageProcessor(RequestQueue* internalQueue,
00006                                                    RemoteRequestManagerHandler* rHandler,
00007                                                    LocalRequestManagerHandler* lHandler,
00008                                                    OutgoingClient* client) :
00009     _internalQueue(internalQueue),
00010     _remoteHandler(rHandler),
00011     _localHandler(lHandler),
00012     _client(client),
00013     _shutdown(false)
00014 {
00015     pthread_mutex_init(&_runMutex, NULL);
00016     pthread_mutex_init(&_queuedItemMutex, NULL);
00017 }

00043 void
00044 InternalMessageProcessor::run()
00045 {
00046     int runfailed = -1;
00047     struct timespec check_timeout;
00048     clock_gettime(CLOCK_REALTIME, &check_timeout);
00049 
00050     runfailed = pthread_mutex_timedlock(&_runMutex, &check_timeout);
00051 
00052     if (runfailed) {
00053         return;
00054     }
00055     
00056     // Kinda hacky, is this a good way?
00057     // queueLock locks the lock.  RequestQueue unlocks the lock when
00058     // an item is added to the queue, allowing us to block until items
00059     // are ready to be processed.
00060     _internalQueue->queueLock(&_queuedItemMutex);
00061     while(!_shutdown) {
00062         struct timespec timeout;
00063         int result = -1;
00064         
00065         clock_gettime(CLOCK_REALTIME, &timeout);
00066         timeout.tv_sec += 10; // Wait 10 seconds for timeout
00067         
00068         result = pthread_mutex_timedlock(&_queuedItemMutex, &timeout);
00069 
00070         // timedlock returns 0 on success, other on error/timeout
00071         if (!result) {
00072             // Do the processing of the queue item here
00073             processReadyQueue();
00074 
00075             pthread_mutex_unlock(&_queuedItemMutex);
00076             _internalQueue->queueLock(&_queuedItemMutex);
00077         }
00078     }
00079 
00080     pthread_mutex_unlock(&_runMutex);
00081 }
00082 
00083 void
00084 InternalMessageProcessor::shutdown()
00085 {
00086     _shutdown = true;
00087 }
00088 
00089 void
00090 InternalMessageProcessor::processReadyQueue()
00091 {
00092     std::queue<queueItem*> itemQueue;
00093     // All internal items are service id 0
00094     itemQueue = _internalQueue->getItemQueue(0);
00095 
00096     while (!itemQueue.empty()) {
00097         processQueueItem(itemQueue.front());
00098         itemQueue.pop();
00099     }
00100 }
00101 
00102 void
00103 InternalMessageProcessor::processQueueItem(queueItem* item)
00104 {
00105     int methodId = item->methodId;
00106     int serverId = item->serverId;
00107     arguments argList = item->argList;
00108 
00109     // Only know how to handle method id 1 (shutdown) now
00110     if (methodId == 1) {
00111         // shutdown the processor
00112         _shutdown = true;
00113     }
00114 }
